channel.title: Server
channel.description: Well i have 2 computers that share the same router, i portforwarded and people can get on my server. BUT when i try to log in from my 2nd computer(The one im not hosting on) from my server ip in the cmd promt it says 'checking server status...' How can i log in from 2 computers on the same server?

item.title: Server
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Mopar1 Mr Mopar
item.description:
@Mr_Mopar1 wrote:

[quote=“Adam, post:2, topic:302563”]Usually you can just use the network address of the hosting computer. Such as: 192.168.1.2

You’d need to find out what the hosting computers IP is. Simply right click on your internet connection in the taskbar and select Options or whatever it is. Then go from there.[/quote]
So i would use 70.######?

Read full topic

item.title: Server
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

Usually you can just use the network address of the hosting computer. Such as: 192.168.1.2

You’d need to find out what the hosting computers IP is. Simply right click on your internet connection in the taskbar and select Options or whatever it is. Then go from there.

Read full topic

Well i have 2 computers that share the same router,
i portforwarded and people can get on my server.
BUT when i try to log in from my 2nd computer(The one im not hosting on)
from my server ip in the cmd promt it says ‘checking server status…’
